fields.summary: Allow users/groups access to edit the name of calendars (and edit calendars), not just the creator.
Make People Calendar summary field a text box, not a single line
Make Team Calendars display in a Confluence Page Gadget, for use on a JIRA Dashboard
Ability to subscribe to JIRA Calendars
Auto refresh Team Calendars of type "Jira"

fields.description: Allow users to select AM PM time format instead of the 24 hours format
fields.summary: Allow users to select AM PM time format instead of the 24 hours format
Week view should have a default sensible time window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51402].
  {panel}

Following a recent support ticket with a customer, I have been asked to create this improvement request to ask for an improvement in the way Team Calendars import functionality works. The customer needs to import 88 ICS files from their old Calendar and then reassign the calendars to their respective owners.

The customer's workflow for each of the 88 ICS files will be as follows:

   * Communicate the process to the customer
   * Download all ICS files
   * Perform the migration
       ** switch to user x (using SU plugin)
       ** import ics
       ** go to the calendar page containing the calendar
       ** add the user calendar there, and make the color match the original one.
   * Get approval
       ** Present
       ** Process feedback

As such, they have requested that we consider ways of easing their pain in future, such as providing some form of automated import functionality and/or allow imported files to be assigned to different owners so that it isn't necessary to follow the above steps to migrate from their old calendar into Team Calendars.
fields.summary: Improve the Import Functionality for Team Calendars
Extract the timezone-dd-template and user-timezone-dd-template scripts into something that can be cached

fields.description: To make the calendar useful for us and for others who have heavily customized JIRA for their custom development processes we would want to be able to use a number of different custom dates on an issue to drive how/when it shows on the calendar. In our case we use a planned development start/end date set and a deployment date (start/end date would be the deployment date. Eventually we will have a requirements gathering start/end date as well. Some of our other groups have additional other start/end dates or just individual dates which would be used for both the start and end date.
fields.summary: Custom Start/End Dates
Modify the add calendar dialog to include "Import" and "By URL"
Show week number in Team Calendar
Show total (summary) days
Make calendar names searchable within Confluence
Update the team calendar automatically when a new meeting is updated in Outlook Calendar.
Same width tabs in event calendars

fields.description: When an event is added it shows on the calendar with just the time and the name - you can't see what the event is unless you click on it. The summary needs to also be displayed so you can see that someone is not just busy but doing what.
fields.summary: People calendar events need to show the summary
Improve upcoming events view logic - filter by #of events, not by #of days
Add ability drag and drop Jira calendar events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51388].
  {panel}

*Team Calendars' behavior depends on the UI language*
When users with French UI create a new event calendar, for example, that calendar is sort into a section "Calendriers dévénements." But when users in German or in English create a event calendar, that calendar is plied under the section "Events Calendars." Team Calendars regards Calendriers dévénements and Events Calendars are different categories. I think this is a bit confusing as the same type of calendars are filed under different sections based on which UI langusge users use when they create a new calendar. 

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create an event calendar in English
# Change your language pack to French
# Create an event calendar in French

Outcome: A new heading is created for "Event Calendars" on the right

Expected Outcome: The event calendar you created in French should go under the same "event calendars" heading as the English one. The only thing that should change is the title of the "Events Calendars"
fields.summary: Calendar type names same for all languages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51387].
  {panel}

Would like to have Team Calendars be able to display issues in a JIRA calendar based on created date. Currently this is not selectable. 

I've gone and created a custom field in my JIRA project 'Created On' and made it required. 

I then can use jql (project = test AND created >= 2011-10-01 AND created <= 2012-10-31) and the custom field 'Created On' to get a calendar for my project showing how many issues were created for this project and when they were created. However, this does not allow me to create these calendars for historical data. 

I think it would be good if we can get Team Calendar to use the created field that is native to issues in JIRA to display from.

Screenie attached.
fields.summary: Ability to select "issue created date" for JIRA calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51386].
  {panel}

Feature request to track sprint start and end dates in Team Calendars. 
We could do this by adding the ability to show sprint start an end dates with the list of fields to show (e.g. "Show:
- Version Due Dates
- Issue Due dates
- Sprint Durations
... etc..")

Related GreenHopper feature request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3254
fields.summary: GreenHopper Sprint integration
2 Way Sync of Google Calendar Events, Allowing Event Edits in TeamCal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51384].
  {panel}

When multiple team calendars are selected for display on a page, the calendar color is rendered by there isn't any identification of the calendar name or associated color.  The only place you can see the association of calendar color and calendar name is on the Team Calendars page where you manage all the calendars in the Confluence instance.

It would be useful and nice to be able to display a legend as part of the calendar view (month, week, list)
RED - CONFERENCE ROOM A
BLUE - CONFERENCE ROOM B
GREEN - CONFERENCE ROOM C
fields.summary: provide an option in the team calendars macro to display a color legend
Allow confluence-admin to update restrictions on a team-calendar
Reduce the amount of white space in the list view when there are only a few events
Remove "Hide" from the calendar menu
Read/write access from Outlook
Fix Team Calendars breadcrumb link
Make OD's TeamCalendarsTest reuse Team Calendars page object or extract the spec and remove the test
Lotus Notes Integration for Team Calendars

fields.description:
I just had an IM conversation with Nanako who was confused why we wasn't receiving email notifications on calendars she's added to her "my calendars" view. Short of doing "autowatch" how about giving users the option to watch a calendar when they add it to their my calendar? Just spoke to Sam and she suggested the following:
* instead of an alert, just have a checkbox next to the "Add" button like we do in comments:
* (nice to have) have that checkbox tie into the user's autowatch settings...so that it's checked by default if the user has autowatched turned on and un-checked by default if the user has turned off the autowatch setting in Conflunence.

!https://img.skitch.com/20110722-d5g6nr89hakhemdngnm2ak82sa.png!
fields.summary: Option to Watch a calendar when you add it to your personal calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51370].
  {panel}

Team Calendars should show each event summary.

The suggestion is to show it in a tooltip when hovering over an event. So weather a team member is on leave/training/etc. 

This suggestion began as a [question on the answers forum|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/81496/showing-event-summary-on-team-calendar]

A hover would work even better if the event field was customisable as a dropdown selection (feature request [TEAMCAL-523|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-523])
fields.summary: Showing event summary in tooltip on team calendar event
Improve appearance of error icon for Team Calendars by making it match color of error dialog
Integrate with daily/weekly summary email

fields.description:
So the label should read

"Show"

And the two checkboxes should say

"Issue Due Dates"
"Version Due Dates"

(Note the capitalisation - currently it says "issue due dates" and "version due dates")
fields.summary: Add JIRA Calendar - Remove "Show" from checkbox value - Redundant wording

fields.description:
I just had an impromptu user testing session with Nanako in Finance and she uncovered an interesting problem she had when getting started:
She's a new user who was told to "subscribe" to the finance leave calendar so:

# She went to the calendar option in the user dropdown (so far so good!)
# She got the time zone pop-up and set it. (great!)
# She got a pop-up saying "there are the most popular calendars. She subscribed to some of those (huge win!) BUT
# She didn't see the finance leave calendar anywhere because it wasn't a popular calendar.

Soooo...I think we could solve this issue is to add a "search" link to the bottom of the popular calendars dialog

!https://img.skitch.com/20110722-rnarnjymn8as4y6cbgp1ej5jyy.png!
fields.summary: Link to search dialog from the "popular calendars" dialog
Add Ability for an event to occur on the Xth day of each month, week, etc...
Support embedded JIRA calendars (of public projects) for the anonymous user

fields.description: It is perfect that now Team Calendars supports groups/users restrictions but users who has no rights to see calendar they see error message. As for our customers it looks like something critical. It would be perfect to add to macro an option with which we can suppress error or hide calendar at all.
fields.summary: Additional option for macro to optionally suppress privileges error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51358].
  {panel}

We completed our migration to Team Calendars last weekend.
It took nearly 15 hours of manual work to import that calendars, set permissions on them, and update the wiki markup on pages where the calendar was used.
Much of that time was spent waiting.
If you're importing a large number of calendars the performance of the "My Calendars" section gets slower for the following actions as the number of calendars listed increases:
# Importing an additional calendar
# Setting permissions on a calendar
# Removing a calendar from the list

As a Confluence administrator, you may wish to have a large number of calendars visible on your "My Calendars" page. However, the performance impact is huge.
From what I can tell the performance slow down is a combination of re-loading all calendar information for changes that affect only a single calendar, and the browser then parsing the returned calendar data, generating the DOM, and re-painting.
fields.summary: My Calendars page performance degrades linearly as calendars are added
Provide access to MS Exchange

fields.description: When deleting a recurring event (that is to be removed from future occurrences), the standard calendar behavior (in other tools) of "just this instance" or "all future instances" isn't offered up as an option.
fields.summary: Deleting recurring event doesn't give "just this" or "all" options
When adding an event with a macro, order calendars alphabetically

fields.description: Unlike the column macro, if you enter _500px_ in the Width parameter for the Team Calendars Macro, an error is returned. Entering _500_ works.
fields.summary: Allow users to specify calendar macro width in the format of "x px"
Take advantage of UPM 2.0 licensing API
Allow option to use global logo for My Calendars page
Show loading indicator on dashboard and don't throw errors if users navigates away before calendar is loaded
Add a feature Event Details like used to have in Calendar plugin
For month view, change calendar legend so they appear sideways instead of under each other

fields.description:
At the moment, if the team calendar license is not active or has expired, the following message is shown with a link to the team calendar license page in the admin section.

!teamcal-read-only.png!

The team calendar license page -is not- +should not be+ accessible to administrators in Studio / OnDemand, so this message should have a link to my.atlassian.com instead, because that's where OnDemand customers will administer their license.

To implement this, we can have the licenses generated by HAL encode a key value pair like this:

{code}
com.atlassian.ondemand = true
{code}

Then some code in team calendars could check the license for this value and display the appropriate message.
fields.summary: Display different 'read-only' message in OnDemand
Allow groups to be associated to Events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51344].
  {panel}

When events are currently loading in Team Calendars, there's a small spinner beside the add event button. On higher resolution and/or larger screens, this spinner is TINY and hardly noticeable.

It would be better if the entire calendar area was greyed out with a central, larger spinner to indicate that events are loading. When the events are loaded, the spinner disappears and the grey overlay is removed.

This comes from a place where we have users in Dublin with events on a server in California.
It can take longer that people are used to retrieve the events when there a big geo-gap.
fields.summary: When loading events it should be more obvious that something is happening
Allow the users to choose the number of weeks that the calendar will show
CalDAV support
Internationalization
Calendar owners should be able to remove members/subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51336].
  {panel}

We noticed this in a few customer interviews, one customer went through the effort of adding a jquery hack of removing the icon from the upcoming events view.

Why? When they only have one event calendar, all the icons look the same, and it looks a bit recidivous.

Internal example: http://cl.ly/image/2z2g370w1S0C

Proposal:
* Add a new param to the macro which is "Show event icon" with the field tip "Applies for list view only", unchecked by default
fields.summary: Macro option to hide the event icon for upcoming events view

fields.description: It would be nice if the portrait and/or username shown when clicking a People event was itself hyperlinked to the user's profile.
fields.summary: Username / icon on a People event pop-up should be clickable, like page comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51333].
  {panel}

A customer had the following [question|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Team+Calendars+FAQ?focusedCommentId=288657309#comment-288657309] on CAC:

bq. Hey, is it necessary to have a login in order to insert someone's vacation into the calendar? for example we have three users, Peter, Max and Jane and only Peter and Jane have a login. Is it possible for Peter to insert Max'es vacation into the calendar so that this inserted vacation does not appear to Jane as Peter's vacation?

If you could add users to a people calendar via email, you'd be able to add someone to a people calendar without them being a user of the system.

It could also be a good way to spread Confluence to potential new users ;)

!https://img.skitch.com/20120526-jci56xhmr2s7995m9yebyi6uxk.png!

!https://img.skitch.com/20120526-1xg583986at5rpmrkb4jjge2r7.png!
fields.summary: Reference a person in the people/who field by email

fields.description: Would make sense to add an option to select the first day of the week. In Europe for example we are used to see the week starting with Monday instead of Sunday. (this applies for week and month view)
fields.summary: First day of the week
Macro should link to my calendars screen with create dialog launched if no calendar found
Allow calendar macro to request Jira calendar without having to add calendar first to team calendars

fields.description:
Hello!

We have Zimbra 7.1.2 and use it as corporate mail software. Also we have Confluence with Team Calendar. It would be great if booth of this applications can exchange data with each other. Because now we have 2 unsynchronized Calendars...

Thank you!
fields.summary: Exchange Team Calendar's tasks with ZIMBRA 7.1.X
Load dashboard calendar asynchronously
Hide Weekend or Hide Day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51323].
  {panel}

Although this is similar to TEAMCAL-269, this is more focused on the reporting use case. 

We've had requests for the ability to get calendar information for reporting purposes. This is a slightly different set of API requirements than the ability to create, edit and update calendar events.

This issue is to track the general requirements to:
* Get a listing (or sub-set) of calendars based on some query 
* Get some calendar metadata 
** Creator
** Last updated 
** # of events
** etc...  

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of January 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for all of your votes and comments on this suggestion.

Unfortunately, this suggestion isn't currently on our roadmap. We do though understand the value such an API would bring, and and will consider this suggestion at a later date.

For those of you who aren’t aware, in our Team Calendars 5.5 and 6.0 releases we brought a range of new improvements, including a fresh new look and feel, better event frequency options, and CalDAV – the ability to use Team Calendars in your favourite calendar app. For more information on these improvements, see: [5.5 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/team-calendars-5-5-0-release-notes-942863254.html], and [6.0 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/team-calendars-6-0-release-notes-947182030.html].

Best wishes,
Jenny | Confluence Server Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Provide an API to retrieve calendar details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51322].
  {panel}

When a macro is embedded on a page (month/week/list views) we should
* Show below the macro the calendar(s) that are displayed 
* Provide the ability for a user to "subscribe (and/or watch)" to each calendar embedded. We can use this opportunity to make the mycalendars.action view more discoverable.

For example, you might go to a page that has embedded the PM Travel Calendar. Below the month view it says "Calendars: PM Travel Calendar, PM Leave Calendar". Each of these could be links to the preview calendar action, making that section more discoverable. We could even put up a dialog that says "you can access this again from the Username > Calendars" menu or the dashboard link (insert screenshot here)
fields.summary: Make subscribing and watching a calendar from a macro view more discoverable

fields.description:
Mockup shows on/off states.

Text area should be clickable, underline on hover.
fields.summary: Change how we turn calendars on/off
Year View
Use AUI jQuery UI instead of bundling it
Add a "hide others" action

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# create an event
# In the "When" field, set a start date that's a few months out from the current date
# The click on the end date, notice that the current date is selected by default. It would ideally show the start date since the end date would HAVE to happen on or after the start date.

This is especially painful for events that happen many months out because you have to click through the calendar a few times to get back to your date. 

Notice how Orbitz does it:
!https://img.skitch.com/20110620-d83rqc553qjjsqh9fnf7sbyfna.gif!
fields.summary: Create Event Dialog: Ending Date should be based on the starting date
Adding Icons for events
Out-of-the-box there should be padding between "upcoming events" and the welcome message
Need a "what's new" dialog for 1.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51307].
  {panel}

When calendar events are displayed on the dashboard, the name of the calendar is included in brackets to the right of the event name.
When a user clicks on an event within the month or week view, the name of the calendar is not displayed, but it is assumed that the user will be able to determine the calendar name from the event colour. When there are a lot of calendars involved in a single view, this becomes difficult. 
In the event view, include the name of the calendar.
On the list view, also include the name of the calendar similar to the way it is displayed on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Display the name of the calendar on the detail pop-up and on the list view
Summary field (in People Calendars) should be made bigger

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51304].
  {panel}

See http://cl.ly/1B473Y2I1V3P091x3x37:

We should make sure it only stays on one line. Suggestion:
Jens Sch.... (jens[at]atlassian.com)

Or put a character limit on the whole line
fields.summary: Long names don't look nice when adding multiple people in people calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51302].
  {panel}

Creating this on behalf of a customer.

This is best explained by the following screenshot:
!teamcal.jpg!
The problem here is that users might accidentally click on the greyed dates as highlighted in the picture and create an event in the wrong month. We could either limit the ability to create events in a different month, or better differentiate the different months in a single view.
fields.summary: Limit the ability to create events on a different month than the one the user is currently viewing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51301].
  {panel}

Ideally meetings rooms could be resources attached or scheduled into a meeting...these would have their own availability calendars and be linked to location or really they would define location (Meeting Room 2, Level 4, 30 Gawler Rd).

Rooms could have specs: number of people it can hold, projector, whiteboard etc

i.e I want to schedule a meeting: I find an available meeting room an invite it to the meeting as well...this could be done with other resources (laptops, projectors, vehicles, etc).

I need a corporate car to get somewhere for a meeting...I can book it it out?

This might rely on seeing availability across multiple calendars.
fields.summary: Meeting Resources and/or Resource Calendars
Make user picker in people dialog use the new frother control
Team Calendars - multiple URLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51296].
  {panel}

When a user creates a calendar, they are given write/view permissions to the calendar which are immutable.  

*Why this is a problem*
There is no mention anywhere of who created a specific calendar.  This means that unless you know exactly who created the calendar there is no way to know for sure who does and does not have access to the calendar.  More importantly, there are no restrictions you can enact that will keep the creator from viewing/editing a calendar they have created.

*Use case*
There are a number of scenarios that I can think of as to why the creator would need to be excluded, these include standard role changes/resignations/replacements etc.  I can also see a person entering a mass of new calendars for a company (Think repetitive data entry following a known format) that is later tweaked by the group it is associated with.  After the creation of the calendar, these groups may want to restrict their calendar but they would have no idea that the creator would still be able to view/edit their calendar.
fields.summary: Change immutable permissions granted to creator of calendar

fields.description:
- Add 5px to the bottom margin of day dividers.
- Add 8px to the top margin of day dividers (except the first).
- Reduce 8px from the top margin of events (except the first)
- Move event title left 3px so it aligns with the event description.
- Move event title and description column left 20px so it is not so distant from the time column.
fields.summary: Upcoming Events - Visual Cleanup
Ability to select a particular date on calendar from a drop down menu rather than scrolling to it manually
Don't limit issues in JIRA Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51292].
  {panel}

As can be seen from the attached screenshot, the jira issue on the right has the value of 30th December 2011 for the fields "JC Issue Due Date" and "JC Lets scynchronise"

Both of these fields have been mapped in the Edit Calendar dialog.

It has been approximately 15 minutes since the issue was created but it is still yet to be reflected on the Jira calendar.

This is definitely not a caching issue as the changes were not seen on a fresh browser that had not displayed the calendar before the changes were made.
fields.summary: Eliminate lag time between setting date in JIRA field and seeing changes reflected on JIRA calendar
Rename "Delete" to "Remove..." in the subcalendar menu
Allow JIRA Calendar to be filtered by user, group, role, component, and version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51289].
  {panel}

The macro property panels buttons in 2.3 are really nice and useful.

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/292127997/TeamCalendars2.3-Confluence4Macro-1.png?version=1&modificationDate=1339987899689!

Could we extend this awesomeness with a placeholder image for each view? It would work like the status macro, so when you click on a button to change the view from week to month, it changes the placeholder image from the week image to the month image.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120716-nch6ccmttd5t8a3yyffrgg1j19.png!

It should be pretty simple if you got one of our awesome designers, [~htapia]
[~vfatia], to give us images for each view :)
fields.summary: Image Placeholders for calendar macro

fields.description:
On the dashboard, the list of upcoming events does not show enough information. I would expect that when clicking on an item I would visit the calendar page with that item, or that at least the detail bubble box (the one you see when clicking on an item in calender view) is shown.

You could also display all available information on this event when hovering over the event.
fields.summary: "Upcoming Events" items should be links
Team Calendar Page Linking Should Use Page Title Instead of Page ID as its Identifier

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51285].
  {panel}

I've found that during release planning, there's a lot of friction to create this - I bounce in and out of Team Calendars in to JIRA.

What if I could create my JIRA releases from Team Calendars? 

Concepts: 
!teamcal-create-jira-versions1.png!

!teamcal-createjiraversions-2.png!

We could also extend it to have the concept of a "Start date" for a JIRA version, but that would be a specific field on the Confluence side.

Interested to hear customer feedback / thoughts on this
fields.summary: Ability to create JIRA versions from Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51284].
  {panel}

Grouping calendars for larger organisations can be challenging. Why is this important? Users often want to logically group a set of calendars together so that they can:

* Embed a set of calendars related to a specific team on a page (embed via category/label)
* Share a set of calendars for a team ("hey, here are our team calendars")
* Report / search for calendars by category/label.

We've got a similar concept in Confluence Space Categories, we should consider following a _similar_ model.
fields.summary: Ability to create categories (or labels) for calendars
Use autocovert to convert preview links into calendar macros
Add month, week and list view to Team Calendars macro properties panel
Mobile friendly calendar macro
Option to configure week format in Calendar settings
